The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the aera Böblingen, in Germany

Name: Wickedest of Them All
Description:
In every city, there is one witch who's the most popular, most powerful and above all the most wicked. Wickedest of Them All pits 2-4 players against each other as they take on the roles of some of the most ruthless modern witches of all time, each one with one goal, to be the WICKEDEST OF THEM ALL!

Players choose a witch and draw cards. Their goal is to see which character has the highest wicked rank by the end of the game. Each witch has special powers and three attributes. Magic, Wicked, and Status. Status is used to play minions and magic is used to cast spells.

Actions: a Player can perform one action on their turn. They may summon a minion, use a character action, cast a spell, or have a minion attack. Playing equipment or minions do not count as actions and can be played at no "cost" during a turn.  A character can have up to 2 pieces of equipment in play.

Spells
Each spell has a number magic rank, in order for a witch to use a spell her magic rank must be equal to or higher than the spells magic rank.

Status and minions
A witch can call forth a minion in her player's hand if the witch has an equal or higher status than the minion.

Spells and minions as actions
Can be cast to affect the game, cast on minions or victims or cast on other spells as actions. Minions have an attack rank and can damage other minions and victims doing damage to their target.

Gaining wicked: Some spells grant bonuses to wicked as do destroying victims and minions. All minions are worth one wicked and victims are worth an amount of wicked equal to their "goodness rank".

End Game.
When the deck is depleted, the player whose character has the highest wicked wins.

Name: All About Allentown
Description: From the game instructions: The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a residence square to the bank and shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on his shopping list wins the game!

Name: Monopoly: Westland
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Dutch local community Westland.

Name: Monopoly: Vlieland
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Dutch island Vlieland.

Name: Wing Leader: Eagles 1943-45
Description:
A copy of Wing Leader: Supremacy 1943-1945 is required to play Wing Leader: Eagles.


(From GMT's website:)

Wing Leader: Eagles is the second expansion for GMT’s Wing Leader system. Eagles adds more aircraft, and more thrilling scenarios from the late war. Fly Hs 129 tank busters against the Soviet armored spearheads. Lead Ki-45 bomber-killers attacking B-29s over mainland Japan. Direct Coastal Command Mosquitos to strafe Luftwaffe airfields in Norway. Launch Me 163 rocket fighters against swarms of B-17s.

New Aircraft will also include the German Me 210 and He 177, the Soviet Yak-3, Yak-9U and La-7, the Japanese Ki-44 and Ki-100 fighters, as well as key late-war Swedish aircraft, including the J 22, B 17 and B 18. Counters for Finnish and Hungarian fighters make their debut in the game.

In addition to new aircraft and scenarios, Wing Leader: Eagles features a new campaign game, which recreates the 5th Air Force campaign against Rabaul in late 1943. The campaign comes with its own 11 x 17” campaign map, and will confront the American and Japanese players with tough decisions on targeting, force planning and raid execution in the lead-up to the invasion of Bougainville.

Wing Leader: Eagles brings the major air combats of the late war right to your gaming table!

Name: Hammered Heroes
Description:
A balanced strategy game with attitude that's designed to get your drinking friends into card games and your card game friends drunk.

Hammered Heroes is a kickass battle card game that is great for any gaming night. Why waste time with friends playing silly games like quarters or king's cup, when you could play something with a little more brains, and a lot more treachery?

Hammered Heroes is a great way to introduce new friends to tabletop, and the initiated will find plenty to love as well.

Your numbered HAMMERED HEROES compete with your opponents' numbered heroes, for QUEST CARDS. CHEAP SHOTS are used by players to disrupt your opponents' plans, or increase your chances of winning.

After FIVE ROUNDS, the player with the most QUEST CARD POINTS wins. But be wary, CURSES and PARTY FOULS abound!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tali
Description:
Tali is the historic Roman version of Knucklebones. Featuring the tactile feel of simulated Bones and upgradeable to metal historically based coins.  Helping bring History back to life.  Tali, recreates the knucklebones game of gambling as the Roman's used to play it.  Two games in one, Tali includes the historic rules played 1000 years ago as well as a micro role-playing game version with more player options and complexity.

Knucklebones is the ancestor to dice, before there were dice, the knuckle bones of sheep (or sometimes goats) would be used as it had a regular shape of four possible sides to land on.

The Romans would sometimes mark the knuckle bones with different roman numerals on each side, I,III, IV and VI.  The roman numerals would then be used to score the throw of the bones.

Players ante into the game similar to modern gambling games.  Once to play and then for each round.  Every round each player will get to throw the bones.  You score when getting at least one VI.  The player who achieves either a Venus or the highest total will win the round and the coins in the round pot.

The Venus throw will win the game pot and the round pot (each face, I, II, IV, and VI).

A micro role-playing game has been added to the historic base game, in which each player selects a historic character from 1000 AD to play.  Each character is given a rich background and a set of powers / capabilities to help them win in Tali.

Are you feeling lucky?  Are the gods with you tonight?

Name: 7 Ghosts
Description:
Be the first player to capture seven ghosts!

On their turn, a player chooses a top card from one of the 4 main decks that they will attempt to win. These cards may be ghost, zombie, scary pumpkin, or haunted house cards. They then roll the three dice in an effort to satisfy the conditions to win that card. If successful, the player takes it and places it face-up in front of them, drawing any "spooky action" cards as instructed.

They may PLAY any spooky action cards they have before relinquishing their turn to the next player. Spooky action cards may place a deck "off limits", force an opponent to play for a specific card, manipulate dice, split, etc. There are also three "ghost" cards in this deck that count toward your overall ghost total.

Collecting sets of 3 of zombie, pumpkin, or haunted house cards allow special powers that are important later in the game. A special effect of winning a haunted house card is getting to "peek" at the bottom card of the deck it came from, which helps direct a players strategy.

A few of the main deck cards have a "vanish" effect, which can be spent to move a card from the top of a deck to the bottom, thus keeping it away from an opponent. Spending a "vanish" card in this way may break up a valuable set of three, so care must be given before deciding this course of action.

Play continues until one player has acquired seven ghost cards and is declared the winner.

Contents: 60 cards(25 main deck and 35 spooky action), 3 six-sided colored dice, and rules.

Name: Batman Miniature Game (Second Edition): The Book of Magic
Description:
The Batman Miniature Game is a tabletop skirmish game featuring the powerful heroes and evil villains of the DC universe.
Will you join the Dark Knight against the mobsters who terrorize Gotham? 
Or will you join his enemies to bring chaos to the streets and take back the night?

The Book Of Magic contains all the rules required to include Magic in your games of the 2nd edition Batman Miniatures Game. Includes 24 spell card.

A copy of the Main 2nd edition Batman miniatures game is required to use this expansion ruleset.

Name: Congress: The Board Game
Description:
As a member of Congress, your sworn duty is to serve your constituents. Serve them well and they may re-elect you for another term. But a higher prize awaits: the presidency of the United States! The American government is built upon a system of checks and balances. Things get done only when everyone works together. At the same time, only one can rise to the highest office in the U.S. Will it be you? Only time - and the American people - will decide! God bless America!

In Congress: The Board Game, you and your fellow senators compete to earn the most nomination points (“NP”) in order to secure the nomination for the U.S. presidency. This is accomplished by passing bills that reflect your interests and agendas over three terms. You must also support the interests of your state’s residents or risk defeat in your midterm elections, harming your chances in the presidential race. The game is over at the end of the third term and the winner is the player with the most NP.

Each session consists of four phases:

Committee Phase - players bid for 'speakership' and select a bill.

Amendment Phase - everyone takes turns adding riders and/or playing action cards.

Voting Phase - the bill is either voted through in simple majority or killed.

Election Phase - if this is the final session of the term, players receive campaign donations and roll for their election.

After the third term and final election, secret agendas are revealed and NP is counted. The most NP wins, and in case of a tie, richest senator wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: You Did What?
Description:
Drinks not included!
 â€‹"You Did What?" is the first "Laminated Poster Board Game" for adults from Shim and D'rothy. The 18" x 24" game board features original black and white hand-drawn artwork on over 40 spaces. The laminated paper sheet can hang on a wall as a decoration and then be taken down to play the game. The surface is lamination-encapsulated so it can't be easily ruined by spilled drinks.
 Players: 2 or more
Ages: 21+
Typical game duration: 60 minutes
 Great for dorms, party rooms, bars, and your adult clubhouse!
 Bring your own:
6-sided die
coins, bottlecaps, or other play markers
paper
pens/pencils
smartphone/camera (optional)
 ... and get to playing (and drinking, and smoking)!

Name: Highways & Byways
Description:
Highways & Byways is a casual family game - great for board gaming couples and families! Race across the United States in your first used car. You're on a mission to explore all places beautiful and forgotten before your vacation is over.

Start the game by picking a Start Space and a Vehicle. Each Vehicle gives you different abilities, such as moving a little faster under certain conditions or immunity to negative events. Plan your route by choosing byways. Then travel across the country a little bit every day, planning around highway construction, moody weather, and your car's pesky tendency to break down!

The first player to travel all their Byways and circle back to their Start Space is the winner. Each player's route is determined by Byway Cards, which are drafted at the beginning of the game. After routes are chosen, players receive a hand of five Event Cards, one of which is drawn by the clockwise player right before the player can move. Whatever is written on that Event Card - good or bad - happens to the player who is about to move. Players can then travel up to six spaces per turn, trading in each unmoved space for the ability to discard an unwanted Event Card and draw a replacement.

Each time the game comes back around to player 1, a new Construction Card is flipped. Construction Cards block off some of the fastest roads in the game. After five Construction Cards are drawn, players pass their Event Cards.

Name: Escape The Fest!
Description:
Escape The Fest! (ETF!) is a multiplayer set collection card game for 2-6 players (13 and up) and takes 30-60 minutes to play.  In ETF! players (attendees) take turns trying to complete objectives (responsibilities) in order to leave the festival and not lose themselves in it. The first attendee to take care of all their responsibilities or with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Each round (day) brings new rules to observe. Some of the other attendees may be looking for the same responsibilities as you making it harder for you to take care of them. Other attendees may just continue to remind you of how many other responsibilities you have, causing you to stay on the festival grounds longer. You may even make some drastic choices that can help or harm you on your journey. All these things will ensure that no two festivals will feel the same.

—description from the designer

Name: Die Heisse 6
Description:
»Hot Six« … is a trick-taking game, where you try to guess your tricks. This might seem traditional, but the deck is quite innovative: All the suits are made up of a different amount of cards. Additionally, you might want to avoid the »hot SIX«.

Deal all the cards and reveal a new trump-suit for this round. Then, a game round consists of 3 phases:
a) Card swapping: Everybody swaps a card with their right and left neighbour.
b) Betting: Count to three. Then everybody indicates with their fingers, how many tricks they want to make this round.
c) Playing: One player leads a trick, the others have to follow suit.

After the last trick, add up the scores for every player:

+ 1 point per trick

+10 points, if you won your bet
-6 points, if you have the »hot 6«
When a player has 50 or more points, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.
NOTE: You'll find a 2 player-variant here on BGG.

–––––––––––––––– GERMAN –––––––––––––––––––

Heiße 6 … ist ein Kartenspiel, bei dem man seine Stiche voraussagen möchte. Dies wird etwas erschwert durch die Tatsache, dass alle Spielfarben eine unterschiedliche Anzahl an Karten haben. Außerdem gilt es die »heiße 6« zu vermeiden.
Eine 2-Spieler-Variante findet sich hier auf BGG.

–––––––––––––––– FRENCH –––––––––––––––––––

Hot 6 est un jeu de plis, où vous essayez de deviner les plis que vous allez remporter. Cela peut sembler traditionnel, mais le jeu est assez innovant : toutes les couleurs de cartes ont un nombre différent de cartes. De plus, vous devez essayer d‘éviter d‘avoir le „hot 6“.

–––––––––––––––– DUTCH ––––––––––––––––––––

Hot 6 is een slagenspel waarbij je het aantal slagen dat je gaat halen probeert te voorspellen. Dit lijkt misschien op een traditioneel slagenspel, maar het kaartendeck is innovatief: alle kleuren hebben een verschillend aantal kaarten.

Name: Mistborn: House War – Promo Card Pack 1
Description:
Add even more intrigue with these five promotional cards for use with Mistborn: House War!

This set of promo cards includes:
“The Stallion” card: a very confused kandra whose antics can transform Favor into Disgrace

2 Terris Stewards cards whose efforts yield extra Favor for those who collaborate with their peers

2 Augur cards whose Allomancy allows players to reset their resources at an opportune time.

NOTE: Mistborn: House War Promo Card Pack 1 is already bundled in every copy of the Mistborn: House War Prestige Edition; if you’ve purchased the Prestige Edition, you do not need to also purchase this product.

Name: Reverse Charades:  The Classic Game
Description:
Classic charades game in a tin.

Split your group into 2 teams.  Each team selects a guesser (everyone gets a turn guessing) and the rest of the teams acts out the:

- Action
- Song
- TV Show
- Film
- Landmark
- Event
- Book

Use the timer provided to get through as many charades within the two minutes as possible.  Teams take it in turns to act, the non acting team must keep score of how many correct answers the guesser obtains.  After every person on both teams has guessed the winner is the team with the most correct guesses/points.

Not a peep among the team members acting.   You lose a point if you speak or "mouth" any words to each other or the guesser.

Use of objects (or even people) is definitely permitted.  You may use generic charades actions, but remember you're against the clock so you may prefer to dive straight in...

Ready, Set, Go!

Source:  Game instructions.

Name: Act of Treason
Description:
In Act of Treason, players take on the role of Royal Advisors tasked with ruling a Kingdom in the wake of the Kings death. Players are given a secret loyalty card, assigning them as a Traitor, Loyal, or the Heir in hiding. Loyals win by rooting out and eliminating the Traitors, or passing five Quests to safely herald in the new King. Traitors win when four Quests fail, or by finding and assassinating the Heir. Players will scheme, deceive, and persuade in order to complete their objectives.

Each round, players contribute Knowledge cards in secret towards a Quest. Knowledge that matches the colour of the Quest will increase the chance of it passing, whilst off-colour cards increases the chance of failure. Players may vie for powerful Court cards, plot assassinations, or simply pass their action while they garner information. Play continues until the Loyals win and the Heir is safe, or the Traitors win and the Kingdom is left to ruin. As the game progresses, tensions will rise. Players will resort to accusations and assassinations in a last ditch effort to save the Kingdom, or force its destruction.

Act of Treason was inspired by social deduction games like Mafia, Werewolf, and Battlestar Galactica. It takes many aspects of these games and seeks to amplify what makes them so much fun: the social interaction, suspicion and deception! In Act of Treason, the only thing that stands between you and victory is your ability to read, bluff, and persuade others.

Name: Operation: Paperclip
Description:
In post-World War II Germany the scramble is on to mete out the fate to the Reich's most brilliant -and infamous- technical minds. Play as the Americans or Soviets racing to assemble the superior scientific team.  Or you can play as the Nakam vigilante group hunting down the worst perpetrators of the war. Lastly, you can play as an ODESSA Network operative trying to smuggle high value German officers to safety in South America.

Players take simultaneous turns in a frenetic division of characters that have a range of values, special powers, and bestow  infamy tokens. That infamy has to be carefully managed as it can be important information that boost your score, but too much much infamy will tank your score.

—description from the publisher

Name: Peak Oil: Spillover
Description:
Welcome to the near future. Welcome to Spillover, the first expansion for Peak Oil.

Spillover enriches and diversifies Peak Oil by adding variant cards, which change the fundamental rules of the game, and new Demand, Risk, and Security markers. You need the base game to play.

The variant cards introduce new ways to play Peak Oil. They're divided into the categories General, Agents, PR, Endgame, and Scoring, depending on the aspect of the game that they affect. In each game, you can use up to one from each of the five categories, allowing for up to 42 millions of different combinations (made up number).

The new cardboard markers can be used with or without the variant cards. There are new refineries to ship oil to, new dangers to be found on the shipping routes and new Security markers.

Name: What The Film?!
Description:
Actor. Plot. Set.  Combine one of each to make a movie.  Did someone have a better idea than you?  Don't worry, you can stab them in the back and take all their points if you "know people" in the Industry.  After all, it's showbiz.

What The Film?! is a fun party game where you get to come up with crazy movie ideas based on the hand you're dealt. On a player's turn from their hand, a player lays down an actor, set, and plot card. With 300 cards the mashups are endless. Not only are you competing with your friends, you are also fighting the clock. After cards have been played, you have exactly 36 seconds to pitch your movie magic to the table.

Voting is done simultaneously, so you don't have the time to persuade anyone at the table, no one like beggars in the film industry! On the count of three, everyone hands their colored award token to who they thought had the best movie. The player with the most points keeps their cards as points, everyone else discards the cards they played.

We know not everyone is a director at heart, for that reason we added Industry Cards. There are two types of Play Immediately's and Play and Discard and contain good and bad things that can occur on your turn or someone else's. For instance, one card can have you stealing the rounds points or another, causing you to pay union dues, which cause you to lose cards.

After six rounds, the person with the most points is declared the winner, and just like that, you're ready to receive your director of the year award!

Name: Реликвиум (Reliquium)
Description:
In Reliquium each player takes control of one of four warring factions: Chaos Legion, Alliance of Nature, Order of Light and Mountain Brotherhood in struggle to achieve uncontested domination. Path to victory lies through conquering new lands and getting access to more resources, managing troops, and calculated use of legendary warriors from Bestiary.

Players start with 3 castles already built (one of each type). 
Each castle gives player an action based on type of territory it occupies:
Plains - march or issue attack order
Mountain - recruit or issue support order
Forest - build a castle or summon legendary creature.

Players resolve actions one at a time, cycling through all players until no more actions left. After all players are done then combat resolves. Afterwards, play continues to the next round.

The player who manages to build all 9 castles first wins the game.

Name: Star Wars: Family Feud
Description:
It's time to play, Star Wars Family Feud! Are you ready to take on the challenge? Survey says, yes! One of the most popular games in the world now has a twist. The entire family can experience the fun of Family Feud as they never have before through the magic of one of the greatest movie franchises of all time, Star Wars.

Based on a national survey, Cardinal Games placed the top answers on 150 Face Off cards. Figure out the most popular answers and rack up the points. Face off in three rounds, then play the Fast Money Bonus Round with 50 Fast Money cards. The team or player with the highest score wins and is crowned the Star Wars Family Feud champion.

So get ready to test your Star Wars knowledge, and may the Force be with you!

Name: A Wrinkle In Time: A Daring Adventure Game
Description:
A Wrinkle In Time: Daring Adventure Game is a cooperative dice game that captures the journey of the 2018 theatrical adaptation of the Madeline L'Engle novel.

In the game, players take on the role of the story's main characters — Meg, Charles Wallace and Calvin — and work together to solve mathematical puzzles, decode secret messages, and tesser to new locations to rescue Mr. Murry and get home. The engineering of a hexaflexagon is behind the "Flex Enfolders", which when used in conjunction with dice rolls must sum up to progress through five movie-based locations, or levels.

A coding portion of each round relies on players' abilities to communicate and lay out an "operation chain" that aims to generate a successful result, after which they will use the color filtration of Mrs. Who's "Quizzing Glasses" to reveal Mr. Murry's hidden whereabouts.

Name: Rune Society
Description:
Rune Society is a unique and fast-paced strategic card game set in a world of forbidden magic.  In Rune Society you will take an 18 card deck and face off against friend or foe in a variety of tournament style competitive formats.

Rune Society is designed to have the strategy and versatility of a collectible trading card game without the need to chase down rare and expensive cards.

One copy of Rune Society is enough for up to 4 players to each build unique decks and compete against one another in a variety of tournament-style formats.

Players can take those same 4 decks and face an elite Nemesis from the "Rune Society" Universe with the purchase of a Nemesis Deck expansion pack.

Fans of strategic card game tournament play can also combine multiple decks for even more ways to play!

Name: Magik Realm
Description:
Magik Realm is a game designed to recreate the experience of the AH classic Magic Realm with newer and simpler game mechanics.  It is a completely separate game with its own rules and components.  The biggest differences are not needing to choose goals (Victory points are scored) and not needing to record a plan for each day’s actions.

Players choose one or more characters to play and move those characters through the game area of clearings on a 4 x 4 grid of tiles.  They will fight and avoid monsters that appear on the map, look for treasure sites and the treasures therein, meet with natives to buy and sell, hire muscle, and take on quests.  They gain Victory Points by discovering treasure sites, treasure, killing monsters, fulfilling quests, and learning new spells.

The game lasts thirty days.  Characters can perform a certain number of actions each day based on their current health.  The actions include: Move, Sneak, Search, Parlay, Rest, Magic, and Combat.  Every two days, an Occurrence chart is used to randomly determine which monsters and natives appear on the map and which ones leave.  At the end of the thirty days, characters add up the Victory Points they scored and a winner is determined.

—description from the designer

Name: Invasion Busters
Description:
The invaders are coming! Hordes of nasty pests are threatening to invade your country. They can sneak in on container ships or even in the baggage of air passengers. Once here, they will secretly grow and spread, damaging your crops and wilderness areas.

Fortunately you and your biosecurity team have the skills to stop them in their tracks! Intercept them before they arrive, or find them quickly and eradicate. Can you bust every invasion?

The Invasion Busters board depicts a simplified version of a real biosecurity system (based on that of New Zealand). A deck of cards represents invasive species which may arrive, grow and spread. Players co-operate to allocate dice to different biosecurity activities, then roll the dice to see if their actions have been successful. At the end of the game points are gained for the species successfully excluded or eradicated, and points are lost for any species which have become established. Players compare their score to a scale printed in the rulebook to see how well they did.

Invasion Busters was developed specifically for use in the classroom, to help teach concepts of invasion, biosecurity and population dynamics to 8-12 year olds, but has also been enjoyed by their teachers and other grown up invasion busters.

Name: Monopoly: Disney Animation Edition
Description: In 1937, Walt Disney fulfilled a dream and created the world’s first fully animated feature film: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs. Now, over 50 films later, celebrate Disney Animation in this collector’s edition Monopoly game. From Pinocchio and Peter Pan to The Little Mermaid and Frozen, players can imagine and recall the beloved stories, magical characters, and unforgettable family memories. In this edition, players move around the Disney-themed gameboard, building hotels and houses, buying Disney Movies, Vehicles, Magical Objects, and creating new Disney family memories.

Name: Anklebiters: Pixies VS Gremlins
Description:
Pixies VS Gremlins is a light-hearted strategy card game. The objective is to control enough magic rune stones to summon the magnificent and fearsome Wolpertinger! To do that, players choose a faction and send out their minions! Once a player has enough strength to capture a rune stone, its theirs.

But things are seldom so easy. Players will challenge each other by engaging in combat, unleashing mischievous spells, wicked traps and powerful gadgets.

The primary game objective is to capture more rune location cards than your opponents. To capture these cards, each player must choose and deploy some of their minions, which are acquired from their faction deck.

—description from the publisher

Name: UNO: Despicable Me
Description:
Hold onto your overalls! Join Gru and his family, includes his Minions in the Despicable Me UNO!

Play the Mutated Minion card make things a little wild.

And don't forget to yell "UNO!" before you play your last card!

The game is pretty much identical to traditional UNO except there are two special Evil Minion rule cards and two customizable wild cards. Watch for the Evil Minion wild card; draw that card and call out a color. The next player must keep drawing until that color card turns up.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Downeast Dealer
Description:
Downeast Dealer is a fast-paced card game of strategy for 3 to 5 players based on the old Yankee obsession with finding a bargain. Players run auctions, make bids on collectable items, and challenge other players to deals.

Everyone begins with cash and a few bad checks. Play begins with the auction of an item you might find in a classified section of the newspaper, on Craigslist, or in the uniquely Maine publication, “Uncle Henry’s.” Players take turns auctioning these Classified Items to each other and bidding on items to add to their own collection.

Each Classified Item has a point value. The most sought after Classified Item, the Moose Trophy, is worth 100 points. Lesser items, like the Blueberry Rake, are worth as little as 5 points.
A player only earns the points indicated on a Classified Item when they collect the complete set of four cards. When two players each hold the same Classified Item card, one player may “Downeast Deal” to try to capture the set.

Downeast Deals are when bluffing becomes a major element of the game. Players might offer large sums of cash in a Downeast Deal, or they might just throw down a bunch of bad checks. There’s no telling until the deal is done – and the savviest dealer takes the collection (or perhaps a large pile of cash!).

Play continues with auctions and deals until all of the sets are complete. The final scoring depends on the point value of the cards a player has – and the number of sets the player has. Having a moose trophy to hang on the wall is cool – but having a fly-fishing rod in your hall AND a lobster trap in your living room AND an anchor in your cellar is even cooler. Right?

Of course, collectors always run the risk of crossing paths with the village ne’er-do-well, and Downeast Dealer is no different. Keep your collection safe from the Thief. If you don’t, he may run off with your prized heirloom chest!

Name: Exodus Trading Card Game: Crystal Forge
Description:
Crystal Forge is the 3rd set in the Exodus TCG.

Set Description:

Guild Wars on the Horizon: 
Ever since the galaxy-sized nebula creatures collided in the skies over Eeventide, there's been a surplus of stardust & other magical compounds that rained down during the aftermath. This excess supply has led to Drifters far and wide forging new creatures. The emergence of 2 new Guilds, Treeforge & Shardveil, brings all to the brink of war.

Shardveil, their ice not limited to any part of the color spectrum, seeks to bring a halt to the chaos by permanently freezing the world. Treeforge and their vast forests of living trees & mushrooms fight to uproot the spreading ice. Which Guild do you choose?

A Competitive Expansion (Set 3) Crystal Forge:
With new Rarity mechanics, new creature types, & new effects like Reveal and Freeze, the Crystal Forge expansion set introduces all-new cards with new themes & new artwork all jam-packed into 2 new decks that are ready-to-play & fully customizable! None of these cards can be found in other sets!

Details:

This set consists of 2 Competitive Decks. The Treeforge Competitive Deck revolves around Treefolk & Mushfolk and the Shardveil Competitive Deck features ice creatures of all colors, shapes and sizes called Shardfolk. These decks are geared for advanced players who are already familiar with the basics of the game and heavily feature type and rarity mechanics. The decks can be played standalone or customized, and many players purchase 2 of each deck to get a playset (x2 copies) of each card since the set contains 100% new cards. This set contains extremely powerful Ability creatures that combo well with their respective types, and both decks feature a completely blinged-out 20-card foil energy deck with new artwork and a new foil treatment.

Two new Guilds are given official recognition with this set, with the emergence of 2 new Guild Leaders. Oliver Rose leads the Treeforge Guild and Crystallus is the self-proclaimed leader of the Shardveil Guild.

Set Breakdown:

This set consists of 43 cards, including:
8 Rares
15 Uncommons
20 Commons
In addition to introducing new mechanics like freeze and reveal, Existence Games wanted to spoil players by giving them a full foil energy deck in these decks for no extra cost.

Creature Types:
This set introduces the following creature types:

Mushfolk
Storm
Shark
Phoenix

Name: Fox in the Henhouse
Description:
Fox in the Henhouse is a micro-game for 2-4 players that can be played in 10-20 minutes. Each player is trying to accumulate the most Eggs (points) from their Hens. The Fox is a tricky scoundrel that shows up in all the wrong places and chases off the Hens and destroys their Eggs! It’s your job to keep the Fox out of your Henhouse and keep your Hens safe so they can produce as many Eggs as possible.

In Fox in the Henhouse, each player has only 1 card in their hand and two face down cards in front of them. The two face down cards are called your Henhouse. Hen cards have 1-4 Eggs shown on them. You are attempting to gather the most Eggs into your hand and Henhouse by the end of the Week (7 rounds). In addition to each player's hand and Henhouse are two face down cards in the center of the play area called the Field. On your turn you can select a card from anywhere on the table (cannot take a card from someone's hand).  Once you have selected a card, you can choose which of the two cards you now hold to keep and which to put back, then other players take turns following the same format of selecting a card and placing a card.  If a player selects a Fox card they must keep it in their hand unless they are also holding one of the 4 Fox repelling cards (The Farmer, The Farmwife, The Farm Dog or The Rooster).  The 4 Fox repelling cards also have special abilities when played face up to help you manipulate the cards in play.  At the end of the Week all players total up their Eggs and take the number of Egg tokens they have accumulated.  After 4 weeks have been played then the player with the most Eggs wins!

Name: DropMix: Series 3 Discover Packs
Description:
Expand your mix and build your music collection with DropMix Discover Packs. Each pack includes 5 DropMix cards that can create a full song mix and more music mixing possibilities with the DropMix Music Gaming System (sold separately). There are 30 DropMix cards available to collect in each series featuring songs from top artists. Each pack of 5 sold separately.

Dropmix: Series 3 Discover Packs is a collection of 6 such packs. While the packaging of each pack is identical, they can be identified by the card showing through the front window of each pack.

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Deadpool & Friends
Description:
In Vs System 2PCG, players choose a main character, build a deck with exactly sixty cards, and attempt to KO the other player's main character in a game of superhero battles.

Vs System 2PCG: Deadpool & Friends showcases 55 new cards that are Deadpool and Deadpool-related. Like his friends. Including Main Characters, Supporting Characters, Plot Twists, and Locations. Vs System 2PCG: Deadpool & Friends can be combined with any other Vs System 2PCG sets.

This is not a stand-alone game.

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Brotherhood of Mutants
Description:
In VS System 2PCG, players choose a main character, build a deck with exactly sixty cards, and attempt to KO the other player's main character in a game of superhero battles.

VS System 2PCG: Brotherhood of Mutants introduces 55 new cards that focus on the rival of the X-Men! This set includes Main Characters, Supporting Characters, Plot Twists, and Locations. VS System 2PCG: Brotherhood of Mutants can be combined with any other VS System 2PCG sets. A single box contains a full play-set of all cards.

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of Vs. System 2PCG: The Marvel Battles is required to play.

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: New Mutants
Description:
In Vs System 2PCG, players choose a main character, build a deck with exactly sixty cards, and attempt to KO the other player's main character in a game of superhero battles.

Vs System 2PCG: New Mutants showcases the cast of the nostalgic New Mutants comics and introduces new mechanics, Main Characters, Supporting Characters, Plot Twists, and Locations. Vs System 2PCG: SHIELD vs Hydra can be combined with any other Vs System 2PCG sets. A single box contains a full play-set of all cards.

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of Vs. System 2PCG: The Marvel Battles is required to play.
